bibl.title: Sam Hop v. H.F. Bucher. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court 3rd Judicial District holding terms at Port Townsend

body.p: In the District Court 3rd Judicial District holding terms at Port Townsend
In the matter of the application of } Petition for writ _____ for Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. Roger S. Greene, Chief Justice, and Judge of the above entitled Court
Your petitioner Sam Hop respectfully shows to the Court
Ist

That he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty - by H.F. Bucher, collector of customs in and for the District of Puget Sound. That he is in the custody of said collector in the City of Port Townsend Wash. by and is so held contrary to his right.
II
That the cause or pretense of the restraint- of petitioner is a claim the part of the said collector that your petitioner is not
entitled to be and the United States, because said petitioner is a Chinese Laborer
III

That said restraint is illegal in this: That said petitioner is a Chinese Laborer: That he resided in the United States and was a resident in January AD 1881 at which time he left the United States and went to China. That he has been within the the United States since said date, but now seeks to enter and remain within the United States as he has the right to do, but said collector restrained him of his liberty aforesaid--

Wherefore your petitioners pray that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said H.F. Bucher commanding him to have the body of Sam Hop before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and what shall then and
there be considered by your Honor concerning them together with the time and cause of his detention, together with said writ and that he may be restored to his liberty
Territory of Washington County of Jefferson

Hon. Richard A. Jones being first duly sworn on oath says that he is informed and believes that the facts in the foregoing petition and time, that he makes the affidavit in behalf of the petitioner. That he has read the foregoing petition, and believes thence true Richard A. Jones
Sworn and subscribed on before me this 28th day of August AD 1885
James Seavey Clerk
In District Court. In the petition of Sam Hop for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed August 28th AD 1885
James Seavey Clerk
